question.title: What is correct way to hide part of spring data repository methods
question.body:
for example I have UserRepository and I want to make some methods of it private. What is correct way to do this?

@Repository
public interface TestRepository extends JpaRepository<User, Long> {
    
    @Query("From User u join userGroups g Where g in (:userGroups)")
    Set<User> privateFindUsersBelongsToUserGroup(Collection<UserGroup> userGroups);
    
    default Set<User> findUsersBelongsToUserGroup(Collection<UserGroup> userGroups) {
        return userGroups.isEmpty() ? Collections.emptySet() : privateFindUsersBelongsToUserGroup(userGroups);
    }
    
}

I don't want check my collection for emptiness in service layer logic, but I don't want to expose privateFindUsersBelongsToUserGroup method. What is best practices for this case?
